Show that C = {w | w has an equal number of 0s and 1s}
is not regular
Assume that C is regular. Since C is regular, the Pumping lemma says that for any
string s ∈ C of length at least p, s can be divided into s = xyz satisfying the following
conditions:
1

xy i z ∈ C for any i ≥ 0

2

|y| > 0

3

|xy| ≤ p

Let s = 0p 1p . Since s starts with p 0s, to satisfy the third condition, x and y are
strings that contain nothing but 0s. In other words, x = 0j for any j ≥ 0, and y = 0k
for any k > 0. Note that k must be greater than 0 because |y| = |0k | = k, and the
condition 2 says that |y| > 0. Since x = 0j and y = 0k , z = 0p-(j+k) 1p . Let i = 2.
We have
xy i z = xy 2 z
= xyyz
= 0j 0k 0k 0p-(j+k) 1p
= 0p+k 1p
For the string 0p+k 1p to be in C, the number of 0s must be equal to the number of
1s. In other words, p + k must be equal to p. This requires k to be 0. But since k
must be greater than 0, xy 2 z 6∈ B - contradiction. Therefore, C is not regular.

Example
Show that D = {w | w has more number of 0s than number of 1s}
is not regular.
As usual, assume that D is regular and followed by the
statement from the Pumping lemma
If you pick s = 02p 1p , you will not get a contradiction
x = 0j for any j ≥ 0
y = 0k for any k > 0
z = 02p-(j+k) 1p
For i ≥ 2 in xy i z, you add more 0s which makes the result
string still have more 0s than 1s
For i = 0
xy 0 z = xz = 0j 02p-(j+k) 1p = 02p-k 1p
If k is 1, 2p - 1 > p (the number of 0s is greater than the
number of 1s) - no contradiction
If k is p - 1, 2p - (p - 1) = p + 1 > p - no contradiction
Note that 0 < k ≤ p from (2) and (3)
If there is a k that works, no contradiction
Thumrongsak Kosiyatrakul tkosiyat@cs.pitt.edu

Finite Automata 07

Example
Let's try s = 1p 02p . Note that s ∈ D and |s| ≥ p.
Again, to satisfy (2) and (3), we have
x = 1j for any j ≥ 0
y = 1k for any k > 0
z = 1p-(j+k) 02p

We have xy i z = 1j (1k )i 1p-(j+k) 02p = 1p+ki-k 02p
If we increase i, we increase the number of 1s
To get a contradiction, we need the number of 1s to be
greater than or equal to the number of 0s
In other words, p + ki - k ≥ 2p
p + ki - k ≥ 2p
ki - k ≥ p
k(i - 1) ≥ p
i - 1 ≥ p/k
i ≥ (p/k) + 1
xy (p/k)+1 z = 12p 02p 6∈ D - contradiction

Finite Automata 07

Show that
D = {w | w has more number of 0s than number of 1s} is
not regular
Assume that D is regular. Since D is regular, the Pumping lemma says that for any
string s ∈ D of length at least p, s can be divided into s = xyz satisfying the
following conditions:
1 xy i z ∈ D for any i ≥ 0
2 |y| > 0
3 |xy| ≤ p
Let s = 1p 0p+1 . Since s starts with p 1s, to satisfy the third condition, x and y are
strings that contain nothing but 1s. In other words, x = 1j for any j ≥ 0, and y = 1k
for any k > 0. Note that k must be greater than 0 because |y| = |1k | = k, and the
condition 2 says that |y| > 0. Since x = 1j and y = 1k , z = 1p-(j+k) 0p+1 . Let
i = 2. We have
xy i z = xy 2 z = xyyz
= 1j 1k 1k 1p-(j+k) 0p+1
= 1p+k 0p+1
For the string 1p+k 0p+1 to be in D, the number of 0s must be greater than the
number of 1s. In other words, p + 1 must be greater than p + k. This requires k to be
0. But since k must be greater than 0, xy 2 z 6∈ D - contradiction. Therefore, D is
not regular.
Thumrongsak Kosiyatrakul tkosiyat@cs.pitt.edu

Finite Automata 07

Rule of Thumb

If a condition of the language is about inequality (<, ≤, >,
≥), pick a string that is right at the border line to break the
condition
D = {w | w has more number of 0s than number of 1s}
1p 0p+1 needs xy 2 z to add at least one 1
0p 1p-1 needs xy 0 z to take out at least one 0
No need to find a large value of i

Thus, we have

Important: You cannot pick s = 0p

Finite Automata 07

Example

Let's do some analysis about xy 2 z
p2 = |xyz|
|xyz| < |xy 2 z| = |xyyz| because |y| > 0
|xyyz| = |xyz| + |y| = p2 + |y|
p2 + |y| ≤ p2 + p because |y| ≤ p
p2 + p < p2 + 2p + 1 = (p + 1)2

Note that the string xy 2 z can in E if |xy 2 z| = q 2 for some q
Above analysis shows that p2 < |xy 2 z| < (p + 1)2
But there is no q such that p2 < q 2 < (p + 1)2
Thus, xy 2 z 6∈ E - contradiction
E is not regular
